Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

On January 5, 2016, Lance Squire gave a list of his Astrocade projects.  I'=
m glad that he did, as it's good to know what's going on in the Bally commu=
nity.

Lance listed several projects.  Here are my comments on them:


1) B=
alzerk - Lance says that completing Balzerk is partially waiting on figurin=
g out the code for The Incredible Wizard and making the Bally talk.  I sugg=
est that Lance tries working with David Turner on figuring out the code.  D=
avid has begun working on completing more of the disassembly of the arcade =
version of Wizard of Wor.  Maybe the two of them can help each other out a =
little bit.  Lance, have you been able to make the Bally talks at all?  How=
 do you propose to do this?


2) Halloween Demo - Lance wants to finish his=
 dancing Skeletons demo.  The last thing I recall about this project is tha=
t he was trying to sync the graphics better with the sound.


3) Adding Mus=
ic to the Skeletons and the Christmas demo - I wasn't aware that he was wor=
king on this.  Cool!


4) Re-working Astro Battle - Lance would like to mak=
e Astro Battle work more like the Space Invaders coin-op release of the gam=
e.  I know that he had changed some of the graphics already, as well as mak=
ing the missiles/bullets animated, but sometimes the animated bullets would=
 freeze on the screen.  The cool thing about this project, is that Astro Ba=
ttle is only a 4K ROM, and it wasn't even fully used.  Lance can easily dou=
ble the size of the game to 8K and it will still fit comfortably on a cartr=
idge ROM.


5) 3D Maze Display - Lance wants to take his BASIC code for a 3=
D maze display and

plunk it into the Basic Demo cart.  First, I don't reme=
mber ever seeing this BASIC code?  Is it done?  Is it available for downloa=
d to try on real hardware?


Does anyone else have any projects brewing?

A=
dam

--_000_BLUPR16MB03872416BFA3E97C823F2F5BC8710BLUPR16MB0387namp_

On January 5, 2016, La=
nce Squire gave a list of his Astrocade projects.  I'm glad that he di=
d, as it's good to know what's going on in the Bally community.<br>
<br>
La=
nce listed several projects.  Here are my comments on them:<br>
<br>
<=
p>1) <b></b><i><b>Balzerk</b></i> - Lance says that completing <i>Balzerk</=
i> is partially waiting on figuring out the code for
<i>The Incredible Wiza=
rd</i> and making the Bally talk.  I suggest that Lance tries working =
with David Turner on figuring out the code.  David has begun working o=
n completing more of the disassembly of the arcade version of
<i>Wizard of =
Wor</i>.  Maybe the two of them can help each other out a little bit.&=
nbsp; Lance, have you been able to make the Bally talks at all?  How d=
o you propose to do this?<br>
</p>
<br>
<p>2) <b></b><i><b>Halloween Demo</=
b></i> - Lance wants to finish his dancing Skeletons demo.  The last t=
hing I recall about this project is that he was trying to sync the gra=
phics better with the sound.<br>
</p>
<br>
<p>3) <b>Adding Music to the Ske=
letons and the Christmas demo</b> - I wasn't aware that he was working on&n=
bsp;this.  Cool!<br>
</p>
<br>
<p>4) <b>Re-working <i>Astro Battle</i>=
</b> - Lance would like to make <i>Astro Battle</i> work more like the
<i>S=
pace Invaders</i> coin-op release of the game.  I know that he had cha=
nged some of the graphics already, as well as making the missiles/bullets a=
nimated, but sometimes the animated bullets would freeze on the screen=
.  The cool thing about this project,
 is that <i>Astro Battle</i> is =
only a 4K ROM, and it wasn't even fully used.  Lance can easily double=
 the size of the game to 8K and it will still fit comfortably on a cartridg=
e ROM.<br>
</p>
<br>
<p>5) <b>3D Maze Display</b> - Lance wants to take his=
 BASIC code for a 3D maze display and<br>
</p>
<p>plunk it into the Basic D=
emo cart.  First, I don't remember ever seeing this BASIC code?  =
Is it done?  Is it available for download to try on real hardware?</p>=

<p><br>
</p>
<p>Does anyone else have any projects brewing?<br>
</p>
<br>
=
Adam</div>
</body>
</html>
